com.mesosphere.sdk.state

Class StateStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.state.StateStore

  • public class StateStore
extends java.lang.Object
    A StateStore stores the state of a service, including tasks' TaskInfo and TaskStatus objects. Each distinct Task is expected to have a unique Task Name, determined by the service developer.

    TaskInfo objects should be persisted when a Task is launched or when reserved resources associated with a potential future Task launch should be recorded.

    TaskStatus is reported by Mesos to Frameworks at various points including at Task Reconciliation and when Tasks change state. The TaskStatus of a Task should be recorded so that the state of a Framework's Tasks can be queried.

    The structure used in the underlying persister is as follows:
    namespacedPath/ ("Services/NAMESPACE/" or "/")
      Tasks/
        task-a/
          TaskInfo
          TaskStatus
          Metadata/
            goal-state-override
            override-status
        task-b/
          TaskInfo
        task-c/
          TaskInfo
          TaskStatus
      Properties/
        some-property
        another-property

      • StateStore

        public StateStore(Persister persister,
                  java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> namespace)
        Creates a new StateStore where data is placed within a namespace under the provided name.
        Parameters:
        persister - The persister which holds the state data
        namespace - The namespace for data to be stored within, or an empty Optional for no namespacing

      • getPersister

        public Persister getPersister()
        Returns the underlying Persister.

      • storeTasks

        public void storeTasks(java.util.Collection<Protos.TaskInfo> tasks)
                throws StateStoreException
        Stores TaskInfo objects representing tasks which are desired by the framework. This must be called before storeStatus(String, Protos.TaskStatus) for any given task id, and it must behave as an atomic transaction: On success, everything is written, while on failure nothing is written. If the number of taskInfo objects to write is greater than MAX_TRANSACTION_SIZE, taskInfos will be written atomically in groups of MAX_TRANSACTION_SIZE.
        Parameters:
        tasks - Tasks to be stored, which each meet the above requirements
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when persisting TaskInfo information fails, or if its TaskId is malformed

      • storeStatus

        public void storeStatus(java.lang.String taskName,
                        Protos.TaskStatus status)
                 throws StateStoreException
        Stores the TaskStatus of a particular Task. The Protos.TaskInfo for this exact task MUST have already been written via storeTasks(Collection) beforehand. The TaskId must be well-formatted as produced by CommonIdUtils.toTaskId(String, String).
        Parameters:
        status - The status to be stored, which meets the above requirements
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if storing the TaskStatus fails, or if its TaskId is malformed, or if its matching TaskInfo wasn't stored first

      • clearTask

        public void clearTask(java.lang.String taskName)
               throws StateStoreException
        Removes all data associated with a particular Task including any stored TaskInfo and/or TaskStatus.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the task to be cleared
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when clearing the indicated Task's information fails

      • fetchTaskNames

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> fetchTaskNames()
                                                      throws StateStoreException
        Fetches all the Task names listed in the underlying storage. Note that these should always have a TaskInfo, but may lack TaskStatus.
        Returns:
        All the Task names stored so far, or an empty list if none are found
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when fetching the data fails

      • fetchTasks

        public java.util.Collection<Protos.TaskInfo> fetchTasks()
                                                 throws StateStoreException
        Fetches and returns all Protos.TaskInfos from the underlying storage, or an empty list if none are found. This list should be a superset of the list returned by fetchStatuses().
        Returns:
        All TaskInfos
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if fetching the TaskInfo information otherwise fails

      • fetchTask

        public java.util.Optional<Protos.TaskInfo> fetchTask(java.lang.String taskName)
                                              throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the TaskInfo for a particular Task, or returns an empty Optional if no matching task is found.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the Task
        Returns:
        The corresponding TaskInfo object
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if no data was found for the requested name, or if fetching the TaskInfo otherwise fails

      • fetchStatuses

        public java.util.Collection<Protos.TaskStatus> fetchStatuses()
                                                      throws StateStoreException
        Fetches all Protos.TaskStatuses from the underlying storage, or an empty list if none are found. Note that this list may have fewer entries than fetchTasks() if some tasks are lacking statuses.
        Returns:
        The TaskStatus objects associated with all tasks
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if fetching the TaskStatus information fails

      • fetchStatus

        public java.util.Optional<Protos.TaskStatus> fetchStatus(java.lang.String taskName)
                                                  throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the TaskStatus for a particular Task, or returns an empty Optional if no matching status is found. A given task may sometimes have Protos.TaskInfo while lacking Protos.TaskStatus.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the Task which should have its status retrieved
        Returns:
        The TaskStatus associated with a particular Task
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if no data was found for the requested name, or if fetching the TaskStatus information otherwise fails

      • storeProperty

        public void storeProperty(java.lang.String key,
                          byte[] value)
                   throws StateStoreException
        Stores an arbitrary key/value pair.
        Parameters:
        key - must be a non-blank String without any forward slashes ('/')
        value - The value should be a byte array no larger than 1MB (1024 * 1024 bytes)
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if the key or value fail validation, or if storing the data otherwise fails
        See Also:
        validateKey(String), validateValue(byte[])

      • storeProperties

        public void storeProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,byte[]> properties)
                     throws StateStoreException
        Stores multiple key/value pairs atomically.
        Parameters:
        properties - mapping of keys to values
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if the key or value fail validation, or if storing the data otherwise fails
        See Also:
        validateKey(String), validateValue(byte[])

      • fetchProperty

        public byte[] fetchProperty(java.lang.String key)
                     throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the value byte array, stored against the Property key, or throws an error if no matching key is found.
        Parameters:
        key - must be a non-blank String without any forward slashes ('/')
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if no data was found for the requested key, or if fetching the data otherwise fails
        See Also:
        validateKey(String)

      • fetchPropertyKeys

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> fetchPropertyKeys()
                                                         throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the list of Property keys, or an empty list if none are found.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if fetching the list otherwise fails

      • clearProperty

        public void clearProperty(java.lang.String key)
                   throws StateStoreException
        Clears a given property from the StateStore, or does nothing if no such property exists.
        Parameters:
        key - must be a non-blank String without any forward slashes ('/')
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if key validation fails or clearing the entry fails

      • storeGoalOverrideStatus

        public void storeGoalOverrideStatus(java.lang.String taskName,
                                    GoalStateOverride.Status status)
                             throws StateStoreException
        Stores the goal state override status of a particular Task. The Protos.TaskInfo for this exact task MUST have already been written via storeTasks(Collection) beforehand.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - in the event of a storage error

      • fetchGoalOverrideStatus

        public GoalStateOverride.Status fetchGoalOverrideStatus(java.lang.String taskName)
                                                 throws StateStoreException
        Retrieves the goal state override status of a particular task. A lack of override will result in a GoalStateOverride.Status with override=NONE and state=NONE.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - in the event of a storage error

      • deleteAllDataIfNamespaced

        public void deleteAllDataIfNamespaced()
        Deletes all data in the state store, but only if it's under a namespace. This is used to clear a namespaced service's data when it's being removed from a multi-service system.
